0958858b-0310-46ed-ba42-b6fe4c946a43: A faith hunter chooses a single {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} that opposes her own along either the law/chaos axis or the good/evil axis. Creatures of this alignment are her sworn enemies.
e7b340ec-1640-4293-98eb-8257b661cb4f: An inquisitor is proficient with all {g|Encyclopedia:Weapon_Proficiency}simple weapons{/g}, plus the longbow, shortbow, and the favored weapon of her deity. She is also proficient with light armor, medium armor, and shields (except tower shields).
863a7afe-c08a-440c-874a-f0cc1e8f117c: At 10th level and every 4 inquisitor levels thereafter, a faith hunter can smite her enemies one additional time per day, to a maximum of four times per day at 18th level.
3bdd925b-b627-4ee7-9935-d3d95af2e6ab: At 11th level, an inquisitor can use mental and physical resiliency to avoid certain {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g}. If she makes a Fortitude or {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will saving throw{/g} against an attack that has a halved {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} on a successful save, she instead avoids the damage entirely. This ability can only be used if the inquisitor is wearing light armor, medium armor, or no armor.
60afcce5-f2db-4581-8aac-c56d3b3caf38: At 12th level, a tactical leader can use the tactician ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
9ba0e0a8-3cec-4916-ab25-ac3552f78bda: At 12th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her bane ability, the amount of bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} dealt by the weapon against creatures of the selected type increases to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g}.
e30b775e-f460-4c1d-a472-ea6f0d8051bd: At 12th level, your sentence ability also makes all your {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} ignore the sentenced target's {g|Encyclopedia:Concealment}concealment{/g}.
86a15553-c043-4651-974c-b5d4be6ba457: At 14th level, a tactical leader can grant his judgment benefits to a single other ally within 30 feet who can see and hear the tactical leader as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}. These benefits last for 1 minute. A tactical leader can use this ability a number of times per day equal to his {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier (minimum 1).
f83136c8-ffd8-41cd-accc-54ffec104f08: At 14th level, the inquisitor learns to take advantage of any opportunity that presents itself. Whenever the inquisitor scores a {g|Encyclopedia:Critical}critical hit{/g}, she ignores any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g} the target might have. In addition, if the target has {g|Encyclopedia:Regeneration}regeneration{/g}, the creature loses regeneration on the {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} following the critical hit and can die normally during that round. Creatures whose regeneration always functions are immune to this ability.
6b9a414f-168e-4497-857e-b457f75dee61: At 16th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, she selects three different judgments, instead of just two. This only consumes one use of her judgment ability. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, the inquisitor can change one of these judgments to another type.
ae8a9089-186e-4ce1-9392-cc334acf04b8: At 1st level, a sanctified slayer gains the slayer's studied target class feature. She uses her inquisitor level as her effective slayer level to determine the effects of studied target.
16f219b7-34eb-425c-bdde-2f3290494ae3: At 20th level, an inquisitor can call true judgment down upon a foe during combat. Whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, the inquisitor can invoke true judgment on a foe as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Once declared, the inquisitor can make a single {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g}. If the attack hits, it deals {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} normally and the target must make a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} or die. The {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} of this save is equal to 10 + 1/2 the inquisitor's level + the inquisitor's {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. Regardless of whether or not the save is made, the target creature is immune to the inquisitor's true judgment ability for 24 hours.
5b8db4bf-16e8-4dc5-bdcb-a64609b7fda3: At 2nd level, an inquisitor adds her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier on {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g}, in addition to her {g|Encyclopedia:Dexterity}Dexterity{/g} modifier.
e3d4757d-a95a-455c-bf2c-b53eda617bc8:
At 3rd level, 9th level, and 18th level, a tactical leader gains a teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} as a bonus feat. He must meet the prerequisites for this feat. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, the tactical leader can grant these feats to all allies within 30 feet who can see and hear him. Allies retain the use of these bonus feats for 3 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} plus 1 round for every 2 inquisitor levels the tactical leader has. Allies do not need to meet the prerequisites of these bonus feats.
The tactical leader can use this ability once per day at 3rd level, plus one additional time per day at 6th, 9th, 15th, and 18th level.
At 12th level, a tactical leader can use the tactician ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
f301e0dd-c907-4892-97cf-e3657deff72c: At 3rd level, a judge gains the ability to share his judgments with all allies in a 30-foot radius. He can use this ability as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g} once plus one time for every 6 levels thereafter. The bonuses work until the end of combat.
a25ebe91-bec7-4be1-809c-f5979a5a062b: At 3rd level, a sacred huntsmaster automatically grants her teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} to her animal companion. The companion doesn't need to meet the prerequisites of these teamwork feats.
1c8dec46-50f7-4262-995d-0cc1d943c906: At 3rd level, all of the inquisitor's allies are treated as if they possessed the same teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} as the inquisitor for the purpose of determining whether the inquisitor receives a bonus from her teamwork feats. Her allies do not receive any bonuses from these feats unless they actually possess the feats themselves. The allies' positioning and {g|Encyclopedia:CA_Types}actions{/g} must still meet the prerequisites listed in the teamwork feat for the inquisitor to receive the listed bonus.
8681adfb-b3f8-4807-afcd-e0f923500b82: At 3rd level, and every three levels thereafter, the inquisitor gains a bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} in addition to those gained from normal advancement. These bonus feats must be selected from those listed as teamwork feats. The inquisitor must meet the prerequisites of the selected bonus feat.
1d526bec-a888-43df-bbc2-6f3820fe5ade: At 5th level, a judge gains the ability to sentence a target as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}. Until the end of combat, all {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} against the target made by your allies deal additional {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} equal to 1 point for every 3 inquisitor levels you have. You can use this ability once plus one time for every 5 levels thereafter.
cdef8b7e-9885-4ab5-885c-6b04399f825f: At 5th level, every time a monster tactician casts a summoning {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, all creatures summoned by the spell are treated as if they knew all of the monster tactician's teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g}.
4214ee2a-8fa8-486c-8117-27a43aaf63a2:
At 6th level, once per day as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, a faith hunter can smite one foe she can see. If the foe is of the faith hunter's sworn enemy {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g}, the faith hunter gains a +4 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} against that foe and a bonus equal to half her inquisitor level on {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g} made against the foe. Smites against targets of the faith hunter's sworn enemy alignment automatically bypass any {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} the creature might possess. If the faith hunter targets a creature that is not of her sworn enemy alignment, the smite is wasted with no effect.
The smite effect remains until the foe is dead or the next time the faith hunter rests and regains her uses of this ability. At 10th level and every 4 inquisitor levels thereafter, a faith hunter can smite her enemies one additional time per day, to a maximum of four times per day at 18th level.
0f880ccd-67d2-43eb-9bb7-cfa308340e3c: At 8th level, whenever an inquisitor uses her judgment ability, she selects two different judgments, instead of one. This only consumes one use of her judgment ability. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she can change one of these judgments to another type.
9c9c601c-9868-4592-b916-d69e057535eb: At 8th, 16th, 17th, and 20th levels, a sanctified slayer can gain a single slayer talent, including those from the list of rogue talents that a slayer can take, but not an advanced slayer talent.
99a04e4c-8553-422a-9b2f-f953db1eb640: Certain relentless inquisitors burn with special hatred for an enemy of specific convictions, and they stop at nothing when obsessively hunting these foes down.
bf8a98f9-5553-4dfb-9d2b-5bb338345abf: Inquisitors are skilled at sensing deception and intimidating their foes. An inquisitor receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made for intimidation and {g|Encyclopedia:Perception}Perception checks{/g} equal to 1/2 her inquisitor level (minimum +1).
c09feea9-0599-46fe-9918-8b4b0c443e0b: Inquisitors are their deities' weapons of retribution. They possess many divine {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, mostly using them to empower themselves, and fight with a weapon favored by their deity. Depending on their specialization, an inquisitor can be deadly in melee or ranged combat.
b2d66c6e-3112-497c-8612-14b7d8047814: Inquisitors can cast a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Cantrips_Orisons}orisons{/g}, or 0-level {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. These spells are cast like any other spell, but they are not expended when cast and may be used again.
94189a48-5d25-4f05-a2d3-1e5537315eb9: Inquisitors tend to move from place to place, chasing down enemies and researching emerging threats. As a result, they often travel with others, if for no other reason than to mask their presence. Inquisitors work with members of their faith whenever possible, but even such allies are not above suspicion.
c0ad2788-478a-4f89-a0d8-dd38194eacc1: Rather than pursuing their holy missions alone, some inquisitors see the inherent value of working with like-minded allies to accomplish mutual goals.
797ddcfa-4a57-4cee-b7e9-0045c3077ac5: Some inquisitors create a strong bond with an animal companion, and they hunt and punish threats to the faith as an awe-inspiring duo. When they work together as one, there are few that dare to stand in their way.
46a595bf-1f37-431e-b191-2259436b6985: Starting at 1st level, a monster tactician can cast summon monster I as a {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g} a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Wisdom}Wisdom{/g} modifier. She can cast this {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g}, and the creatures remain for 1 minute per level (instead of 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} per level). At 3rd level and every 2 inquisitor levels thereafter, the power of this ability increases by 1 spell level, allowing her to summon more powerful creatures (to a maximum of summon monster IX at 17th level). A monster tactician cannot have more than one summon monster spell active in this way at a time; if she uses another, any existing summon monster immediately ends.
3e1756b2-1acd-4eb0-9c53-8c3290cd7344: Summon Monster IX (Ghaele Azata or Thanadaemon)
a431d19e-617c-4480-8361-f83b5838ae9f: Summon Monster IX ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} Monadic Devas or Frost Giants)
32b6b3c9-4042-4f30-8417-706eb927d8d6: Summon Monster V (Bralani Azata or Redcap)
0ce0be30-c8c2-4f26-a1a1-f445517bdf0d: Summon Monster VI (1d3 Bralani Azatas or Redcaps)
e383a1c6-6435-45da-b4a2-f5f0e8b23eed: Summon Monster VI (Axiomite or Soul Eater)
e5a3669e-2fbd-495d-87ba-f9490d342694: Summon Monster VII ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} Axiomites or Soul Eaters)
84fb4828-3c02-407f-8a96-fbdd0a3b7b83: Summon Monster VII ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 Bralani Azatas or Redcaps)
3cc6d850-d81e-46b1-89b3-854758257d60: Summon Monster VIII (Monadic Deva or Frost Giant)
d9beedf8-fd54-448f-85ec-8762611b005e: Summon Monster VIII ({g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}+1 Axiomites or Soul Eaters)
cf4e2bf6-aca9-4a4e-980d-3742587307e3: Tactical leaders are skilled at speaking soothing words that keep the peace and bolster allies' resolve. A tactical leader receives a morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion{/g} skill {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} (when used for diplomacy) equal to half his inquisitor level (minimum +1).
5506ec6e-bb06-4d9c-817a-d77d42e7c30d: The character gains bonus teamwork {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feats{/g} that empower the allies who both have them while fighting side by side. The inquisitor gains the benefits of these feats even if their allies do not have them.
9aff410d-a495-4cb3-933b-e4a2d5810654: The inquisitor is protected from the vile taint of her foes, gaining a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every five inquisitor levels she possesses. At 10th level, the bonus is doubled against curses, diseases, and poisons.
b522c0ed-10b7-460b-b1db-836cf9e0a1c3: The inquisitor is shielded by a flickering aura, gaining 2 points of {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}energy resistance{/g} against all elements (acid, cold, electricity, fire, and sonic). The protection increases by 2 for every three inquisitor levels she possesses.
6eaa61e8-60f9-4490-9c45-d739a21f0d46: The inquisitor is surrounded by a {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healing{/g} light, gaining {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 1. This causes the inquisitor to heal 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} as long as the inquisitor is alive and the judgment lasts. The amount of healing increases by 1 point for every three inquisitor levels she possesses.
09584022-f88f-481c-add4-43c1d90476b0: The strength of conviction of some inquisitors is so great that they can, with a single word, sentence an enemy to {g|Encyclopedia:Injury_Death}death{/g} while increasing their allies' power.
1a75ee8f-679e-483c-8bee-fa7d4323bb44: These activated abilities give the inquisitor powers of their choice. Unlike many other effects, they keep working until the end of combat. For example, the inquisitor can choose to {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heal{/g} a small amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each turn.
e9dd1316-d97d-4b12-97d6-efd60c3cbcb2: This ability empowers the inquisitor's weapon. It can be used several times a day. It can help deal a lot of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, but, unlike the judgments, its time of use is very limited.
9da91bc4-3355-42cc-8838-dd4520fd5532: This judgment bathes the inquisitor's weapons in a divine light. The inquisitor's weapons count as magic for the purposes of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}damage reduction{/g}. At 6th level, the inquisitor's weapons also count as one {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} type (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful) for the purpose of bypassing {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} reduction. The type selected must match one of the inquisitor's alignments. If the inquisitor is neutral, she does not receive this {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g}. At 10th level, the inquisitor's weapons also count as adamantine for the purpose of overcoming damage reduction (but not for reducing hardness).
0777109a-d907-44d1-b3f0-c09a1576eb22: This judgment gives the inquisitor great focus and makes her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} more potent. This benefit grants a +1 sacred {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Concentration}concentration checks{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} made to overcome a target's {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g}. This bonus increases by +1 for every three inquisitor levels she possesses.
9b6cb3c0-bb52-4686-836b-7dc825c908f6: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/chaotic. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
5b52c9b5-d0b1-4d2c-89f9-4ae1e4f3df6e: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/evil. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
1c95f751-94a2-4d59-b5f6-3d34c912f845: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/good. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
7e93eee1-64e4-4b8c-837a-ae660d4f1ca0: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/lawful. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses.
7ae2b199-899d-4924-845c-2045c46552b3: This judgment makes the inquisitor resistant to harm, granting {g|Encyclopedia:Damage_Reduction}DR{/g} 1/magic. This DR increases by 1 for every five levels she possesses. At 10th level, this DR changes from magic to an {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}alignment{/g} (chaotic, evil, good, or lawful) that is opposite the inquisitor's.
61721970-5390-4ae1-8bab-cce8be7154c8: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons a bogeyman. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
b4556a2e-23ef-46b4-b3e9-986372f0372c: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons a frost giant if you are evil or a monadic deva if you are not. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
0bce297a-c619-4081-a639-113ee2d0b942: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons a thanadaemon if you are evil or a ghaele azata if you are not. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
4bfe2913-a359-4df1-94f0-4ee9b45c451e: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dire wolf, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar monitor lizards, or 1d4+1 extraplanar wolves. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
50877350-1442-4b75-b839-3954ef58c359: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dire wolf. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
9d35674a-a9aa-40ae-bd0f-a3ab9368004a: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar dog. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
be1b650c-c839-4552-a939-c659fe20b6a6: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar monitor lizard, {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar wolves, or 1d4+1 extraplanar dogs. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
d06fcbf5-7e58-4b88-81cb-b0671c68430c: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar monitor lizard. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
e6a3b2c2-c691-4fe2-b666-3ffd9d2ea3f4: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar wolf or {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dogs. The summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
10949c32-7549-4dc7-abf5-af8409195a03: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons an extraplanar wolf. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
46fa6300-6d9a-4157-97e3-21019c1dd375: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons one extraplanar redcap if you are evil or one extraplanar bralani azata if you are not. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
1e0df1e3-0b6b-4405-b2c9-a81bcf861c45: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons one extraplanar soul eater if you are evil or one extraplanar axiomite if you are not. It appears where you designate and acts according to its {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. It {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} your opponents to the best of its ability.
e616e709-9e5f-44ce-b430-f5b1a7b8b9b3: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar bogeymen, 1d4+1 extraplanar soul eaters if you are evil and 1d4+1 extraplanar axiomites if you are not, or one frost giant if you are evil and one movanic deva if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
6f1a5954-710a-4698-8084-b8b751e49a60: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar bogeymen. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
0f932611-605c-4bcf-8aa0-5036679cca7a: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dire wolves, 1d4+1 extraplanar monitor lizards, or one extraplanar redcap if you are evil or one extraplanar bralani azata if you are not. Summoned monsters appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
eba5727b-11b6-4809-b86a-17233f9dd8ad: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dire wolves. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. They {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} your opponents to the best of their ability.
dd36bd6c-23d5-4a95-924a-181321e06a08: This {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} summons {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} extraplanar dogs. They appear where you designate and act according to their {g|Encyclopedia:Initiative}initiative{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}check{/g} results. 39f9803a-5a10-4420-a5ec-84846ac04e56: While all inquisitors root out enemies of the faith, in many orders and churches there's a select group of these religious hunters devoted to one goal, and one goal alone — to terminate the enemies of the faith wherever they can be found. Sometimes these sanctified slayers are given special dispensation to commit ruthless murders for the faith's greater good. Other times, they're simply willing to take the initiative to revel in the zeal of such grisly work.
8685dd49-a916-4695-8577-2679b4d9e14b: While most inquisitors have learned to take advantage of the movements of their opponents and allies in combat, some instead summon creatures as a means of claiming strategic advantage, exploiting the mystic connection between themselves and their summoned creatures to impart a bit of their own tactical knowledge.
